member.name: T:Sudoku.Checking.DeadlyPatternChecker
member.summary: Checks a technique structure whether it forms a deadly pattern.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Checking.DeadlyPatternChecker.IsDeadlyPattern(System.Int16[],System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified technique structure forms a deadly pattern. This method only checks for at most 1000 solutions. If the pattern contains more than 1000 solutions, this method will always return .
member.param: An array of mask list as a technique structure.
member.exception: Throws when the argument is a valid puzzle, or length is not 81.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Checking.MinimalPuzzleChecker
member.summary: Provides with a checker that determines whether the puzzle is a minimal puzzle.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Checking.MinimalPuzzleChecker.IsMinimal(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Determines whether the puzzle is a minimal puzzle, which means the puzzle will become multiple solution if arbitrary one given digit will be removed from the grid.

param.name: firstCandidateMakePuzzleNotMinimal
param.para: Indicates the first found candidate that can make the puzzle not minimal, which means if we remove the digit in the cell, the puzzle will still keep unique.
If the return value is , this argument will be -1.

member.exception: Throws when the puzzle is invalid (i.e. not unique).

member.name: T:Sudoku.Checking.MissingDigitsSearcher

member.summary: Indicates the inner solver.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Checking.MissingDigitsSearcher.GetMissingDigits(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@)
member.summary: Finds all missing digits that makes the grid have unique solution when one of them are filled in the grid. Returns when this method doesn't find out any possible missing candidates.
member.returns: An array of digits found and confirmed being missing, whose valid range is from 0 to 728. will be returned if no possible missing candidate found. For example, the grid won't be valid until at least two missing digits should be filled at the same time.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Generating.PatternBasedPuzzleGenerator
member.summary: Indicates a puzzle generator that uses the pattern-based sudoku generation algorithm.
member.remarks:
The main idea can be shortened into the several following steps:
Randomize to generate a pattern which contains about 24 cells.
Randomize to get some numbers (Just about 3 digits is okay). These digits should guarantee the validity of the pattern.
Try to solve this as the multiple solution puzzle. Our aim in this step is to get a valid solution.
Remove digits not filled in the pattern.
Check validity of the removed puzzle.
If the puzzle is unique, generated successfully, and return this puzzle;
otherwise, adjust pattern slightly and try again. If failed after having tried 10000 times, we will re-generate a sudoku puzzle.

member.name: F:Sudoku.Generating.PatternBasedPuzzleGenerator.RetrialTimes
member.summary: Indicates the times that can retry a new pattern without updating sudoku solution template.

member.name: T:Sudoku.Solving.Algorithms.Backtracking.BacktrackingSolver
member.summary: Defines a solver that can solve a sudoku puzzle, using backtracking algorithm.

remarks.para:
Please note that the current type has no optimization on solving. Therefore sometimes the puzzle will be extremely slowly to be solved although it is not very hard by manually solved. One of the examples satisfying the above condition is:
..............3.85..1.2.......5.7.....4...1...9.......5......73..2.1........4...9
The current solver may spend about 4.5 min on solving this puzzle.

For more information, please visit
this link .

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.Algorithms.Backtracking.BacktrackingSolver.Solve(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@)
member.summary: To solve the specified grid.

param.name: result
param.para: Different with other methods whose containing type is , this argument can be used no matter what the result value will be.

member.returns:
A ? value indicating whether the grid can be solved, i.e. has a unique solution. Please note that the method will return three possible values:
The puzzle has a unique solution.
The puzzle has multiple solutions.
The puzzle has no solution.

member.name: M:Sudoku.Solving.Algorithms.DictionaryQuery.LinqSolver2.Solve(Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@,Sudoku.Concepts.Grid@)
member.summary: To solve the puzzle.

returns.para: The method will return if the puzzle has more than one solution, or if the puzzle cannot be solved.
Please note that the method cannot return due to not being aware of the uniqueness of the puzzle.
